Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a light-brown pottery vessel, the interior is spotted in places with traces of a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and very faint traces of at least four lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393315) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393315)
